{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3306495,"name":"chrisrin","username":"chrisrin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chrisrin/{size}/160418_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T19:37:41.925Z","cooked":"

We got what we asked for; there is now more flexibility than ever when it comes to pool noodles for bumpers. Hollow and solid are still allowed, and diameters between 2.125" and 2.75" are now allowed. I looked at one of our hollow noodles, and the hollow was about 1". So the range of actual foam area in a cross-section of noodle varies from around 2.8 in^2 (min diameter hollow) to 5.9 in^2 (max diameter solid). That‚Äôs quite a wide range.

I see this 2018 discussion / debate between hollow and solid, and it seems like hollow edged out solid back then, though there were plenty of folks on each side.

Since the peak speeds of robots involved in head-on collisions are likely to be faster than ever this year given the new motors, translating to greater forces bumpers need to absorb and distribute than ever, this seems worth revisiting. What was good for the past may not be good now.

What are you using & why? Has anyone done high-force testing on pool noodles & yielded results worth sharing?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-02-11T01:34:04.576Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":678,"reads":530,"readers_count":529,"score":3496.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":454221,"topic_slug":"pool-noodle-preferences-2024","display_username":"chrisrin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/hollow-vs-solid-noodles/166972","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Hollow vs Solid Noodles?","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pool-noodle-preferences-2024/454221/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3306499,"name":null,"username":"anon91718515","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-10T19:42:43.901Z","cooked":"

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2024-02-18T00:16:46.036Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":328,"readers_count":327,"score":80.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":454221,"topic_slug":"pool-noodle-preferences-2024","display_username":"Ben Edwards","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.homedepot.com/p/Robelle-Teal-and-Orange-Swimming-Pool-Water-Noodles-12-Pack-WN12TO/304884151","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":24}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37435,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"EE mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pool-noodle-preferences-2024/454221/8","custom_user_title":"EE mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312019,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-18T00:29:49.620Z","cooked":"

For anyone ordering from Oodles of Noodles, definitely order from their website. I called with questions last week and Dustin was amazingly helpful. Also, they have bulk discounts on the site, and you can mix/match colors to get to the bulk discount threshold (though at the time the site wasn‚Äôt cooperating, so just call and let them know that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre trying to do).

I had a notification from Fedex that my package was picked up within an hour or two of placing it, and it got here 2-3 days later. They do use USPS as well for smaller orders, which may or may not take longer. The threshold between small/large (USPS vs Fedex for the free shipping option) is around 4 packs of 6 hollow noodles.

Amazon orders will not ship through Amazon, so you‚Äôre bound by the same timeframe, but without the option for bulk discounts.

Happy to answer questions about my experience if anyone has any.

We always go local to a shop near the school. They have a variety of colors and sell for $2.95 a piece. I go in every winter and get to tell the nice cashier‚Äôs about the local robotics team and why we need so many noodles. Then I say bumpers and they say oh like battle bots and then blah blah blah. You get it.

This year they asked if we were having a pool party. I wish. It was 29¬∞ before wind-chill and it felt like walking on Hoth

No shipping cost, easy same day pickup and I can always call ahead to make sure they have enough. I always bring a tape measure and check them myself in store before I check out. They were all around 2 3/8 in diameter or just under depending on the bend from being in the box

Wind Surf and Sail Pools

Noodle 12329 - Wind Surf and Sail Pools

Noodle

Wind Surf and Sail Pools, not sure if they ship, I didn‚Äôt even know they had an online store tbh. But they‚Äôve always been open in the winter because they sell spa supplies so it‚Äôs perfect for us to know the will still be open and have em in the middle of a Michigan winter.
